spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Courage (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to saving throws against fear effects.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Endurance (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to saving throws against receiving or increasing exhaustion levels.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Fortune (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
If the blessed creature is continuously attuned to this blessing for one month, they gain a 5% chance to unexpectedly gain 1d10 gp. There is no way to know if the gain of gold is caused by this blessing or not.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Health (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to saving throws against poisons and diseases.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Life (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +1 bonus to death saving throws.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Love (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +3 bonus to Charisma ability checks made when interacting with people they truly love.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Sobriety (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature never becomes inebriated from drinking alcoholic beverages. This has no effect on magical liquids or other substances such as poisons.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of the Crafter (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to all ability checks made with artisan's tools.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of the Green (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The plants that the blessed creature plants and takes care of produce 30% more food when harvested.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Tidiness (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature's clothes never get dirty or stained. They can still be damaged or ruined in other ways.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Action (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
The blessed creature gains +2 on initiative checks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Consistence (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
When the blessed creature makes an attack or ability check, they can forgo rolling the d20 to consider a roll of 10 on the die. This can be used only once and recovers after a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Elemental Protection (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
When this blessing is given, the redeemer must choose one element (fire, cold, lightning, thunder, or acid). When the blessed creature would take damage from that element, it may use a reaction to reduce that damage by 1d6.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Eyesight (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
The blessed creature gains +2 on Wisdom (Perception) checks that are based on vision.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Light (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
As an action, the blessed creature can start to emit light as the light spell. This has no time limit and can be ended at any time with a bonus action.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Resilience (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
Once per day, when the blessed creature suffers a critical hit, it can use a reaction to turn that into a normal hit.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of the Archer (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
When shooting arrows or bolts, the blessed creature can create energy versions of the ammunition that disappear after hitting their target. It is not considered magical and has no magical properties, but allows for an endless amount of ammunition to shoot. Arrows and bolts the blessed creature shoots never break when hitting an enemy. They can still be broken as usual in other ways. Blessing of Elemental Protection: When this blessing is given, the redeemer must choose one element (fire, cold, lightning, thunder, or acid). When the blessed creature would take damage from that element, it may use a reaction to reduce that damage by 1d6.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of the Desert (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
The blessed creature needs to drink water only once every 5 days, and gains advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of heat from hot climates.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of the Prey (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track the blessed creature have disadvantage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Vigor (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
The blessed creature's maximum hit points are increased by 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Air (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
When falling, the blessed creature descends only 60 feet per round and takes no fall damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Power (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The DC of saving throws imposed by the blessed creature are 1 point higher.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Recovery (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature can use an action to make a target creature it touches regain 4d6 hit points. This can be used once and recovers after a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Reflex (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
When the blessed creature is hit by a weapon attack, it can use a reaction to reduce the damage taken by 1d6.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Secrecy (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature has advantage on all Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of the Weapon (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
One weapon the blessed creature holds can be considered a +1 weapon (can be changed at the start of the creature's turn). The redeemer can pay three times the blessing cost to instead make this Blessing apply to all weapons the creature uses, including natural weapons and unarmed attacks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Tongues (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature can understand any language as if affected by comprehend languages.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of War (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature gains +1 to weapon attack rolls.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Water (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature can breathe underwater as if it were air.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Evasion (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Protection (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature gains +1 to AC.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Salvation (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
If the blessed creature would die, it stays alive with 1 hit point, all failed death saves are removed, and it becomes conscious if it wasn't already. This blessing is completely lost when used. This blessing uses two attunement slots instead of one.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Speed (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature's speed increases by 20 feet.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Spell Resistance (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature has advantage on saving throws against spells.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of the Elements (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature gains resistance to two elements chosen randomly from cold, fire, acid, lightning, or thunder when the blessing is given.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of the Mystic (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to its spell attack modifier and spell save DC, but its maximum hit points are reduced by 4 while attuned to this blessing.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of the Skies (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature can activate this blessing for up to 4 hours per day as a bonus action. Once activated, the creature gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed. Each activation has a duration of 1 minute, and when it expires, the creature descends at a rate of 30 feet per round until it lands.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of the Superior Weapon (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
One weapon the blessed creature holds can be considered a +2 weapon (can be changed at the start of the creature's turn). The redeemer can pay three times the blessing cost to instead make this Blessing apply to all weapons the creature uses, including natural weapons and unarmed attacks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of Avoidance (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
All attacks against the blessed creature are made with disadvantage. If the creature takes damage, this benefit is lost until the start of its next turn. This blessing has no effect if the creature is incapacitated, restrained, or otherwise unable to move.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of Haste (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature can make one weapon attack as a bonus action on each of their turns.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of Regeneration (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature regains 1d6 hit points every 10 minutes, provided it has at least 1 hit point. If the creature loses a body part, it regrows and returns to full functionality after 1d6+1 days, as long as it has at least 1 hit point the whole time.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Giant (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Strength score increases by 2, and their maximum Strength score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the King (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Charisma score increases by 2, and their maximum Charisma score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Mind (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Intelligence score increases by 2, and their maximum Intelligence score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Shield (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Constitution score increases by 2, and their maximum Constitution score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Soul (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Wisdom score increases by 2, and their maximum Wisdom score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Supreme Weapon (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
One weapon the blessed creature holds can be considered a +3 weapon (can be changed at the start of the creature's turn). The redeemer can pay three times the blessing cost to instead make this blessing apply to all weapons the creature uses, including natural weapons and unarmed attacks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Wind (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Dexterity score increases by 2, and their maximum Dexterity score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)
